Understand the structure of a direct proof (assume hypothesis, derive conclusion)
Understand the proof by contrapositive technique (prove ¬q → ¬p instead of p → q)
Understand proof by contradiction (assume negation, derive contradiction)
Understand proof by cases (split into exhaustive cases, prove each)
Know when to use each proof technique
Prove existential statements by providing a witness
Prove universal statements using arbitrary/generic elements
Work with even and odd integer definitions (n = 2k, n = 2k+1)
Distinguish between an assumption and a derived statement in a proof
Recognize common proof patterns and strategies
